intro: Osmorhiza longistylis, commonly known as the longstyle cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its fern-like leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and streambanks. Its root system is fibrous and often used in traditional herbal medicine. Osmorhiza longistylis plays a role in supporting local pollinators and contributes to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
